medical_history.chief_complaint: Fatigue, nausea, decreased appetite, diffuse abdominal pain, and decreased urine output in a 5-year-old female; an 8.8 × 6.6 × 9.3 cm pelvic mass with nausea, vomiting, and worsening abdominal pain in a 16-year-old female; headache, vomiting, and refusal to bear weight in a 4-year-old male.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1's symptoms began prior to the presentation with a history of fatigue and abdominal pain. Patient 2 exhibited a 2-week history of nausea, vomiting, and worsening abdominal pain. Patient 3 presented with a 5-day history of headache and vomiting, alongside refusal to bear weight. There were additional complications noted for Patients 2 and 3 during their hospital courses.
medical_history.family_history: Family history significant for benign thyroid nodules and thyroidectomy in the mother, thyroid cancer in a paternal grandmother, and brain tumor in a paternal great uncle who died of disease for Patient 1. Patient 2 had no relevant family history noted. Patient 3 had a maternal great aunt with a history of unknown cancer.
